required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of GC022F CAR-T Cell Immunotherapy for Relapsed or Refractory B- ALL
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of GC022F CAR-T Cell Immunotherapy for Relapsed or Refractory B- ALL

brief_summary.textblock: The study is an early, open, single-centered trial. The aim of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerance of GC022F CAR-T cell immunotherapy in relapsed or refractory B-ALL. The study will include 18 subjects to receive GC022F therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of treatment related Adverse Events, CRS and Neurotoxicity (Safety and tolerability)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events(AEs) will be collected and graded according to ASTCT consensus(for Cytokine Release Syndrome, CRS and Immune Effector Cell-Associated Neurotoxicity Syndrome, ICANS) and CTCAE v5.0(for AE except CRS/ICANS )

secondary_outcome.measure: CAR copies and concentration of GC022F in peripheral blood, bone marrow and CSF (amplification and persistence)
secondary_outcome.description: GC022F CAR copies and cells in peripheral blood, bone marrow and CSF will be measured by qPCR and FCM in 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall response rate of patients who received GC022F infusion (efficacy)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall response rate will be estimated as the percents of patients who achieved CR or CRi.

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentraiton of anti-GC022F antibody after infusion (humoral immune response)
secondary_outcome.description: After GC022F infusion, GC022F antibody in peripheral blood will be measured in 2 years

arm_group.description: The patients will receive one dose of GC022F. GC022F dosage ranges from 6×10^4 to 1.5×10^5 CAR+T/Kg.

intervention.description: GC022F is the CAR-T cell immunotherapy targeted CD19 and CD22. The subjects will receive GC022F as one dose. The dosage ranges from 6×10^4 to 1.5×10^5 CAR+T/Kg.
